page.title: 14Willance's Leap
page.content: Robert Willance was a successful lead miner who loved to explore the Dales hills. He was once out with a hunting party when they were caught in fog. Robert and his horse fell over a 200 foot cliff. The horse was killed but Robert lived and suffered a broken leg To keep his leg warm from the cruel weather Robert slit the horse's stomach open and stuck his broken leg into it. Later on he was found and his leg had to be amputated. Tradition says that the leg was buried in the churchyard in Richmond and in 1615 when Robert died he was buried with the leg. Now there are two monuments where Robert fell in 1606, they are just 2 miles outside Richmond. People often walk there on a Sunday afternoon, the views of the Swale and Richmond breathtaking.
